intro: Hedyotis chereevensis, commonly known as the Chereev's dotseed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Hedyotis chereevensis is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its native habitat.
